member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.DirectX.DirectDrawClippedRect
member.summary: Represents a sprite clipping structure that can be used to draw sprites between surfaces will full edge clipping. These are public members instead of property accessors because they sometimes need to be passed as ref or out arguments and these aren't supported on accessors.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap
member.summary: Seeds a given array with a division/offset based height map. Used by Terrarium for generating variable terrarain. Additional features include computation of a sea level based on percentage area and clamping of height values via a granularity. The current height map supports 256 height values, but can be modified to produce much more detailed terrain.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.Granularity
member.summary: This controls how far the algorithm recurses. Whenever the granularity is greater than the distance between points, the algorithm stops.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.MaxLevel
member.summary: The maximum number assigned to any point on the map.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.SeaPercent
member.summary: Gives a sea level percentage for renegotiating which points are sea level. This dynamically modifies the seaLevel value to achieve consistent results.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.SeaVariance
member.summary: The allowable variance in sea level area. This makes sea level between (seaPercent - seaVariance),(seaPercent + seaVariance).

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.BumpinessFactor
member.summary: The bumpiness factor for terrain computations.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.rand
member.summary: A random number generator used throughout the process of fractal height map generation.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.worldMap
member.summary: The actual height map being generated. By the time the height map is complete the values are already clamped.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.xMapTiles
member.summary: The number of horizontal map locations.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.yMapTiles
member.summary: The number of vertical map locations.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.lastSeaLevel
member.summary: Make sure we can break out of the sea level creation routines in the case we get into a loop where we can't get our percentages correct. This happens on smaller maps quite easily.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.seaLevel
member.summary: Gives an initial sea level value to begin processing the grid for a sea level percentage.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.#ctor(System.Int32[0:,0:],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes a new height map and fills in the by ref integer array with world map values.
member.param: A by ref int array that holds the world values.
The number of horizontal map locations.
The number of vertical map locations.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.ComputeSeaLevel
member.summary: Attempts to lock sea level into a specific amount of area within the map. This method either raises or lowers the sea level value to achieve a consistent amount of water in the final map. Note that this method doesn't change the height field, only how the normalization process clamps height values to tile values.
member.returns: True if the iteration of the method achieved the desired results, false if it should be run again.

summary.para: Clamps the map values from their original height field values, to values used by the world mapping class. This should probably be moved into the World class, but for more advanced height fields that support banding, this method would actually be enhanced to normalize the height field data to bands (deep sea, sea, shore, grass, hills, rock, steep, mountain peak, etc..)
In the current iteration all land is set to 0, unless it is below seaLevel, in which case it is set to 1.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.NormalizeMap
member.summary: Diamond fractal generation only works optimally when the size of the map is of a very specific height and width, and it only works properly if the map is square. The NormalizeMap method attempts to overcome this flaw in the algorithm by iteratively checking points for set values and finally *finding* points that can be used to compute the mid-point.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.NearestPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Find the nearest point to the given point by using x,y delta computations. This method is used to facilitate normalization of unset points in the map.
member.param: The x coordinate of the point being checked.
The y coordinate of the point being checked.
The direction to move on the x axis, should be -1,1
The direction to move on the y axis, should be -1,1

summary.para: Computes a fractal grid in the given area. Since this is a fractal algorithm, this method is called recursively on successively smaller map areas until the entire map has been computed.

If the granularity of the distance between the points is less than the established granularity (2 in this revision), then the method quits out. You can create a sparse map by giving less of a granularity, however, the normalization function will most likely populate all points on the map with valid values anyway based on nearest point calculations.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.SquareAverage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Given 4 points, computes a center point based on average height. An additional random variance factor is applied to the center point to enable *bumpy* transitions.
member.param: One of 4 corner point heights.
One of 4 corner point heights.
One of 4 corner point heights.
One of 4 corner point heights.
The variance factor used for bumpiness
member.returns: The averaged height, +/- a random bumpy factor

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.HeightMap.InitMap
member.summary: Initialize a height field map with values for the initial corners and center. This ensures that the map will have a very specific and consistent look and feel once it is complete. This method current places midPoint values in all 4 corners and the center. Then dynamically computes a high point and low point that will be used skew the map. Note that InitMap sets very specific points. If the points set are selected randomly, then the method of seeding won't necessarily work, since fractal subdivision uses very specific points each iteration.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.MiniMapUpdatedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides access to information about an updated MiniMap (which is the small scaled down map that shows a more global view of the terrarain.

member.summary: Provides access to the minimap.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.MiniMapUpdatedEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate used to define an event used to notify clients of a mini map update.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView
member.summary: Encapsulates all of the drawing code for the Terrarium Game View. This class makes heavy use of the DirectDraw APIs in order to provide high speed animation.

member.summary: The primary screen surface for the picture box.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView._backBufferSurface
member.summary: The back buffer surface used with the picture box.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView._clipper
member.summary: The Clipper object assigned to the PictureBox

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Overrides the Painting logic because painting will be handled using timers and DirectX. If the control is in design mode, then clear it because DirectX isn't available yet.
member.param: Graphics context objects

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.OnPaintBackground(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Don't paint the background when a background erase is requested. Hurts performance and causes flicker.
member.param: Graphics context objects

The number of world pixels

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.ReInitSurfaces
member.summary: Reinitialize all surfaces after they have been lost. This method invokes the garbage collector to make sure that any COM references have been cleaned up, else surface renewal won't work correctly.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.ResizeViewer
member.summary: Handles logic for resizing the game view

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.RenderFrame
member.summary: Renders a new frame of animation. This is the entry point for drawing code and is required every time a new frame is to be drawn.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.TeleporterZIndex
member.summary: ZIndexes the teleporters so they can be properly rendered on the screen.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.RenderTeleporter(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Renders any teleporters that exist between the given z ordered locations.
member.param: The minimum z index.
The maximum z index.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.PaintMessage
member.summary: Controls the rendering of textual messages to the Terrarium client screen. Since DrawText is invoked each time, this method is slow.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.PaintCursor
member.summary: Paints a custom cursor rather than the default windows cursors. Can be used to enable cursor animation, but in the current revision simply paints a custom cursor based on mouse location.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.PaintSprites(Terrarium.Renderer.Engine.IGraphicsSurface,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Paint sprites on the given surface. This method is the meat of the graphics engine. Normally, creatures are painted to the work surface using this method. To increase performance plants are rendered to the background surface only once every 10 frames. Lots of work happening in this function so either read through the code or examine the Terrarium Graphics Engine whitepaper for more information.
member.param: The surface to render to.
True to render plants, false to render animals.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.GetBoundsOfState(OrganismBase.OrganismState)
member.summary: Uses the bounding box computation methods to compute a box that can be printed within the graphics engine. This is used for debugging creature pathing.
member.param: The state of the creature to compute a bounding box for.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.InitTeleporter(Terrarium.Game.TeleportZone)
member.summary: Sets up the hack table with teleporter information. The hack table is used to quickly implement new types of sprites or implement sprites linked to immutable objects (like the teleporter).
member.param: The teleporter zone to initialize.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.InitOrganism(OrganismBase.OrganismState)
member.summary: Initializes a new organism state by computed and attaching a TerrariumSprite class that can be used to control on screen movement, animation skins, and selection.
member.param: The organism state to attach the sprite animation information to.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.UpdateWorld(Terrarium.Game.WorldVector)
member.summary: Updates the sprites controlled by the game view by providing a new world vector from the game engine.
member.param: The new world vector of organisms.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.ResetTerrarium
member.summary: Resets the Terrarium and prepares it for a new world, without having to reboot the entire game.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.ClearBackground
member.summary: Clear any background surfaces to black. This helps find rendering artifacts where portions of a scene aren't updated. Since the background is cleared to black, the portions not updated are clearly visible.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.PaintBackground
member.summary: Renders the Terrarium background image. Also renders plants on the background for static plant drawing to enable higher performance.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.Paused
member.summary: Pauses the TerrariumGameView and stops rendering. A call to RenderFrame will automatically unpause the animation.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.MiniMap
member.summary: Provides access to the bitmap representing the minimap for the currently loaded world.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.TerrariumMessage
member.summary: Enables the textual display of a message over top of the Terrarium view. This property accepts newlines and centers the text on the screen.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.DrawDestinationLines
member.summary: Enables the drawing of organism destination lines within the Terrarium Client

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.DrawScreen
member.summary: Controls the rendering of the entire game view.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.DrawBoundingBox
member.summary: Controls the rendering of organism bounding boxes useful for movement debugging.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.DrawBackgroundGrid
member.summary: Controls rendering of a special background that contains a grid overlay that mimics the Terrarium application's cell grid.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.Cursor
member.summary: Overrides the cursor property so that custom cursors can be implement.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.DrawText
member.summary: Determines if sprite labels should be drawn.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.VideoMemory
member.summary: Determines if the primary surfaces are in video memory or not.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.ViewSize
member.summary: Returns the size of the viewport window.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.ActualSize
member.summary: Returns the full size of the world.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.DrawCursor
member.summary: Determines whether to

member.name: E:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.OrganismClicked
member.summary: Clients can connect to this event and be notified of click events that correspond to creatures within the view.

member.name: E:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumGameView.MiniMapUpdated
member.summary: Clients can connect to this event and be notified of mini map changes that occur during map transitions.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurface
member.summary: Manages Terrarium Sprite Surfaces. Sprite Surfaces are linked to one or more actual surfaces. Each surface can be used to represent a creature's size. Each sprite surface is uniquely identified by name, and is capable of returning the appropriate internal sprite sheet based on the look-up method.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurface.surfaces
member.summary: A collection of surfaces attached to this sprite surface.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurface.sizedSurfaces
member.summary: Determines if this instance supports sized surfaces.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurface.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new sprite surface, initializing the size array to an initial 49 slots.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurface.AttachSurface(Terrarium.Renderer.DirectX.DirectDrawSpriteSurface)
member.summary: Attaches a single, unsized surface to this instance. If sizedSurface was previously set, it is now unset.
member.param: The surface to attach.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurface.AttachSurface(Terrarium.Renderer.DirectX.DirectDrawSpriteSurface,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attaches a sized surface to this instance. No bounds checking is performed. The size should be between 0 and 48. The sizedSurfaces field is set to true.
member.param: The sprite surface to attach to this instance.
The size of this sprite surface.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurface.GetDefaultSurface
member.summary: Gets the default surface. This only works for unsized surfaces.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurface.GetClosestSurface(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to look-up the surface closest to the given size.
member.param: The ideal size of the surface requrested.
member.returns: A surface that closesly resembles the ideal surface in size.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager
member.summary: The Terrarium sprite surface manager manages keyed terrarium sprite surfaces. It attempts to load resources first from disk based image, then from assembly based resources.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new sprite surface manager and clears it out. Clearing it sets up the necessary internal field values.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.isSourceValid(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the given file name is a valid match to the given key.
member.param: The name of the file to check.
The key name to check the file against.
member.returns: True if the file name is valid given the key, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.AddSizedSurface(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new sized surface to the sprite manager. A sized surface attempts to load multiple surfaces for the various sizes of a keyed sprite.
member.param: The name of the sprite surface.
The number of frames of animation.
The number of frame types.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.Add(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a single size surface.
member.param: The key of the sprite surface.
The number of frames of animation.
The number of frame types.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.Clear
member.summary: Clears the sprite surface manager. Creates a new case insensitive hash of sprite surfaces.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a sprite surface from the manager.
member.param: The sprite key of the sprite surface to remove.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.Count
member.summary: The number of currently loaded sprite surfaces.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a sprite surface for the given sprite key.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.Item(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an optimally sized sprite surface for a given sprite key, a given ideal size, and whether or not the type of sprite is that of a creature or plant.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumSpriteSurfaceManager.Sprites
member.summary: Access to the hashtable of sprites. This is direct access to the underlying holding structure. You shouldn't directly manipulate the hashtable returned by this property.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager
member.summary: Manages text based surfaces. Each surface is keyed to the original text that creates it. For performance lengthy strings are concatenated.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager.StandardFontRect
member.summary: Represents the rect each piece of text is drawn within. Each text surface is made exactly this size.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager.sprites
member.summary: The sprites associated with each bit of text.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager.#cctor
member.summary: Initialize the standard font rectangle.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new text surface manager and any internal fields.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new string to the text surface manager. This creates the associated text surface so that text can be rendered with a fast Blt rather than with a DrawText call. Note that caching could be done in a much more efficient manner and some text surfaces will have identical contents.
member.param: The string to add.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager.Clear
member.summary: Clears out any existing text surfaces and reinitializes the hash table for storing keyed surfaces.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the surface associated with the given key.
member.param: The key of the surface to remove.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of text surfaces currently cached.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.TerrariumTextSurfaceManager.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the text surface associated with the given key. If the surface doesn't exist, it is created.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.TileInfo
member.summary: Represents a game tile within the Terrarium world board.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.TileInfo.Transition
member.summary: The transition type for this tile.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.TileInfo.Tile
member.summary: The tile index for this tile.

member.summary: The X Offset location computed using the tileX constant.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.TileInfo.YOffset
member.summary: The Y Offset location computed using the tileY constant.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Renderer.World
member.summary: Creates a Terrarium mapping world given a target height and width. Used by the TerrariumDirectDrawGameView to render the background

member.name: F:Terrarium.Renderer.World.worldMap
member.summary: Holds height information for the world. This is how the height map is created.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.World.CreateWorld(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the mapping using a target number pixels.
member.param: The width of the world in pixels.
The height of the world in pixels.
member.returns: An updated size that has been rounded up to the nearest world boundary.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.World.MiniMapPass
member.summary: Runs a MinMap pass over the World object to create a small version of the world.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.World.TileFilterPass
member.summary: Turns the map into a series of tiles that can index into the background sprite sheet.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Renderer.World.TileOffsetPass
member.summary: Computes the viewport offsets for tiles so that the information is available during rendering and doesn't have to be computed on the fly.

member.summary: The size of a tile in the X direction

member.name: P:Terrarium.Renderer.World.TileYSize
member.summary: The size of a tile in the Y direction

member.summary: Provides access to the generated mini map.

member.summary: Provides access to the array of tile structures.
